src:
Kan bli Norges VM-joker i h√•ndball
Hvem er inne, hvem er ute? Svaret kommer mandag. Da offentliggj√∏res VM-troppen i h√•ndball.
03 Nov 2019, 11:01 by Mette Bugge
Mesterskapet for kvinner foreg√•r i Japan, samme land som et halvt √•r senere skal arrangere OL. Der er Norge forel√∏pig ikke kvalifisert. VM-gull gir en slik plass, men mest sannsynlig blir det OL-kvalifisering til v√•ren.
De syv beste lagene i VM blir med i OL-kvalifisering til v√•ren. Japan er allerede inne som OL-vert.
Med tanke p√• VM-laget pr√∏vde landslagstrener Thorir Hergeirsson og hans team flere spillere i den siste turneringen i Stavanger i september.
De fleste i den troppen blir med til VM. Nybakt mor Stine Skogrand kan komme inn fra sidelinjen.
Bergenseren, bosatt i Danmark, er √©n av mulige kandidater p√• h√∏yre bakspillerplass, der Nora M√∏rk og Amanda Kurtovic herjet tidligere.
M√∏rk trener seg tilbake etter operasjon. Kurtovic er i gang igjen etter korsb√•ndskade, men VM kommer for tidlig.
‚Äì Stine har prestert godt og b√∏r v√¶re hyperaktuell for troppen, sier ekspertkommentator Ole Erevik, som skal til VM for rettighetshaver TV3 (NENT Group).


SETT DENNE? 
Norsk stjerne mister VM: ‚Äì Ekstremt frustrerende




Stine Skogrand vil gjerne v√¶re med til VM.üì∑ JON OLAV NESVOLD / BILDBYR√ÖN NORWAY


Fakta: VM i Japan
Norge spiller i Kumamoto
F√∏rste kamp g√•r mot Cuba 30. november.
Ellers i denne gruppen er Angola, Serbia, Slovenia og Nederland.
De tre beste lagene g√•r videre til hovedrunden.
Norge spiller treningskamper mot Sverige og Slovenia i Japan f√∏r VM.
Finalen foreg√•r 15. desember.

Har god erfaring med ferske m√∏dre
Erevik, tidligere landslagsm√•lvakt, bor i Danmark, der Stine Skogrand spiller for Herning-Ikast.
Skogrand var tilbake p√• banen 26. august, tre m√•neder etter at hun fikk en s√∏nn. Hergeirsson har hele tiden v√¶rt bevisst p√• at ikke noe skal forseres etter en f√∏dsel. Derfor tok han henne ikke med til turneringen i Stavanger. Han ville at hun skulle bli vant til sin nye livssituasjon.
Samtidig har han fulgt utviklingen tett og sett at hun leverer godt p√• banen. 26-√•ringen scoret for eksempel seks m√•l og ble toppscorer sammen med Jeanett Kristiansen da laget for kort tid siden tapte en seriekamp mot Esbjerg, som har seks norske spillere p√• laget.
Skogrand sier ja takk til VM-plass hvis hun f√•r tilbudet. Det er ingen tvil om at Norge trenger sterke spillere bak som er venstrehendte.
Erevik mener at nettopp h√∏yre bakspillerplass kan oppleves som et svakt ledd i kjeden. Samtidig vet han at nye spillere som f√•r sjansen, vokser inn i rollen. Han trekker frem Moa H√∏gdahl som en annen spiller som er aktuell med sin venstrearm. Silje Waage blir i alle fall med.

LES OGS√Ö: Sagosen skal jakte OL-billett p√• hjemmebane



Stine Skogrand var p√• laget i siste VM. Her jubler hun etter seier mot Nederland. F.v.: Amanda Kurtovic, Stine Skogrand, Helene Gigstad Fauske, Marit R√∏sberg Jacobsen, Kari Brattset Dale og Emilie Christensen.üì∑ Vidar Ruud / NTB scanpix

Vipers i f√∏ringen
Det som er sikkert, er at trener Ole Gustav Gjekstad i Vipers Kristiansand f√•r med minst fem, muligens seks, spillere p√• landslaget. De som er sikre er Heidi L√∏ke, Emilie Hegh Arntzen, Marta Tomac, Malin Aune og Silje Waade.
Trolig velger landslagstrener Thorir Hergeirsson √• ta med flere enn de 16 som er med i en mesterskapstropp. Tallet ender fort p√• 19 spillere. Det betyr at Andrea A. Pedersen fra Vipers kan bli den tredje m√•lvakten i troppen, men som reserve.
Det er vanskeligere √• hente ned spillere til VM-byen Kumamoto hvis noe skulle skje i form av skader og sykdom, enn det var da EM ble arrangert i Frankrike i fjor. Da ble Thea M√∏rk skadet tidlig i turneringen. Camilla Herrem ble hasteinnkalt.

FIKK DU MED DEG DENNE? Forskning viser at ut√∏vere som studerer, kan prestere bedre. Men for disse har det v√¶rt alt annet enn enkelt.

Ikke noe er umulig
Siden EM i fjor er spillere som Katrine Lunde, Veronica Kristiansen og Henny Reistad borte.
Kjerstin Boge Sol√•s er ogs√• utenfor p√• grunn av skade. Bent Svele, h√•ndballekspert i TV 2, mener at det er en svekket tropp som drar til VM. Samtidig trekker han frem at Norge fremdeles har et godt lag som m√• ha semifinale som m√•l.
‚Äì Kanskje er ikke Norge like klar gullfavoritt som mange ganger tidligere, men det er heller ikke slik at den gjeveste medaljen er noen umulighet. Alt annet enn semifinale vil v√¶re en skuffelse, men det er noen spenningsmomenter.
Svele har s√• absolutt lagt merke til en str√•lende Skogrand i Danmark.
‚Äì Jeanett Kristiansen har ogs√• v√¶rt sv√¶rt god i store deler av sesongen, men jeg er ikke like sikker p√• at hun kommer med.
text:
Can become Norway's World Cup joker in handball
Who's in, who's out? The answer comes Monday. Then the World Cup squad is published in handball.
03 Nov 2019, 11:01 by Mette Bugge
The women's championship takes place in Japan, the same country that will be hosting the Olympics six months later. Norway is not yet qualified. The World Cup gold provides such a place, but most likely it will be Olympic qualification this spring.
The seven best teams in the World Cup will join the Olympic qualifying this spring. Japan is already hosting the Olympic Games.
With regard to the World Cup team, national team coach Thorir Hergeirsson and his team tried several players in the last tournament in Stavanger in September.
Most people in that squad join the World Cup. Newly baked mother Stine Skogrand can come in from the sidelines.
Bergenseren, a resident of Denmark, is one of the potential candidates for the right-back, where Nora M√∏rk and Amanda Kurtovic ravaged earlier.
Dark retreats after surgery. Kurtovic is up and running again after a cruciate ligament injury, but the World Cup is premature.
- Stine has performed well and should be hyperactive for the squad, says expert commentator Ole Erevik, who is going to the World Cup for licensee TV3 (NENT Group).


SET THIS?
Norwegian star loses World Cup: - Extremely frustrating




Stine Skogrand would like to be part of the World Cup.


Facts: World Cup in Japan
Norway plays in Kumamoto
First match goes against Cuba on November 30.
Elsewhere in this group are Angola, Serbia, Slovenia and the Netherlands.
The top three teams advance to the main round.
Norway plays training matches against Sweden and Slovenia in Japan before the World Cup.
The final takes place on December 15.

Have good experience with fresh mothers
Erevik, former national team goalkeeper, lives in Denmark, where Stine Skogrand plays for Herning-Ikast.
Skogrand was back on the field August 26, three months after having a son. Hergeirsson has always been aware that nothing should be taken care of after birth. That's why he didn't take her to the tournament in Stavanger. He wanted her to get used to her new life situation.
At the same time, he has closely monitored the development and seen that she delivers well on the field. For example, the 26-year-old scored six goals and became the top scorer with Jeanett Kristiansen when the team recently lost a series match against Esbjerg, which has six Norwegian players on the team.
Skogrand says yes thanks to the World Cup if she gets the offer. There is no doubt that Norway needs strong players behind who are left-handed.
Erevik believes that just the right back seat can be seen as a weak link in the chain. At the same time, he knows that new players who get the chance are growing into the role. He highlights Moa H√∏gdahl as another player who is up to date with his left arm. Silje Waage will join us anyway.

ALSO READ: Sagosen will be chasing Olympic home tickets



Stine Skogrand was on the team in the last World Cup. Here she is cheering for victory against the Netherlands. Examples: Amanda Kurtovic, Stine Skogrand, Helene Gigstad Fauske, Marit R√∏sberg Jacobsen, Kari Brattset Dale and Emilie Christensen.üì∑ Vidar Ruud / NTB scanpix

Vipers in the lead
What is certain is that coach Ole Gustav Gjekstad in Vipers Kristiansand will get at least five, possibly six, players on the national team. Those who are safe are Heidi L√∏ke, Emilie Hegh Arntzen, Marta Tomac, Malin Aune and Silje Waade.
National team coach Thorir Hergeirsson probably chooses to bring more than the 16 who are in a championship squad. The figure ends quickly on 19 players. That means Andrea A. Pedersen of Vipers could be the third goalkeeper in the squad, but as a reserve.
It is more difficult to bring down players to the World Cup town of Kumamoto if something were to happen in the form of injuries and illness, than it was when the European Championships were held in France last year. Then Thea M√∏rk was injured early in the tournament. Camilla Herrem was urgently called.

DID YOU GET WITH THIS? Research shows that practitioners who study can perform better. But for these it has been anything but simple.

Nothing is impossible
Since last year's European Championships, players like Katrine Lunde, Veronica Kristiansen and Henny Reistad are gone.
Kjerstin Boge Sol√•s is also outside due to injury. Bent Svele, handball expert in TV 2, believes that a weakened squad is heading to the World Cup. At the same time, he points out that Norway still has a good team that must have a semi-final goal.
- Norway may not be as clear gold favorite as many times before, but it is also not that the most rewarding medal is any impossibility. Anything but a semi-final will be a disappointment, but there are some exciting moments.
Svele has certainly noticed a glorious Skogrand in Denmark.
- Jeanett Kristiansen has also been very good for much of the season, but I'm not so sure that she will come.
